br.usp.poli.takiyama.utils
Class Lists

java.lang.Object
  br.usp.poli.takiyama.utils.Lists

public final class Lists
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides set operations for lists.

Author:
Felipe Takiyama

Method Detail

union

public static final <T> java.util.List<T> union(java.util.List<T> list1,
                                                java.util.List<T> list2)
Returns the list resulting from the union of the specified lists.

The order of elements in the result is determined by the order of elements in list1. If the element is not in this list, then its ordering is determined by the order of elements in list2.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of element contained in the list
Parameters:
list1 - The first list to add to the union
list2 - The second list to add to the union
Returns:
The list resulting from the union of the specified lists

difference

public static final <T> java.util.List<T> difference(java.util.List<T> list1,
                                                     java.util.List<T> list2)
Returns the result of removing the elements of list2 from list1. The order of elements in list1 is preserved.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of element contained in the list
Parameters:
list1 - The minuend
list2 - The subtrahend
Returns:
The list resulting from subtracting the second list from the first list.

Parameters:

                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
TODO Make it more generic Puts the specified element the specified number of times in the list.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of element to put in the list
Parameters:
list - The container where the elements will be put
element - The element to fill the list
num - The number of elements to put in the list
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If num < 0.

areEqual

public static final boolean areEqual(java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> arg1,
                                     java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> arg2)
Returns true if the specified lists of BigDecimal are equal. Equality is verified using BigDecimal.compareTo(BigDecimal), which does not take into account the scale of numbers. Thus, {2.0} and {2.00} are considered to be the same list.

Parameters:
arg1 - The first list to compare
arg2 - The second list to compare
Returns:
true if the specified lists of BigDecimal are equal
See Also:
BigDecimal.compareTo(BigDecimal)

hashCode

public static final int hashCode(java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> list)
Returns the hash code for the specified list of BigDecimal.

This method should be used in association with areEqual(List, List) to maintain consistency between hashCode() and equals().

Parameters:
list - A list of BigDecimal
Returns:
The hash code for the specified list

apply

public static final <T extends Replaceable<T>> java.util.List<T> apply(Substitution s,
                                                                       java.util.List<T> list)
Returns the result of applying the specified substitution to the elements of the specified list.

When the result of applying of the substitution to a given element from the list is invalid, it is not added to the returned list.

Type Parameters:
T - A Replaceable type
Parameters:
s - The substitution to be made
list - The list containing the elements to be substituted
Returns:
The result of applying the specified substitution to the elements of the specified list.
